SEARCH
Module dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform
Package dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.io

Class WriteContext

java.lang.Object
dev.kkorolyov.pancake.platform.io.WriteContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
public final class WriteContext extends Object implements AutoCloseable
A write-only view of a ByteBuffer that serializes object references on the fly. On object write, serializes the data using the nearest Class-matched Serializer provider on the classpath, and stores an incrementing ID reference to the serialized instance. Subsequent writes of this instance will instead write that single ID to the backing buffer. To maintain this order-reliant encounter guarantee, it is critical that a provider Serializer.write(Object, WriteContext) data in the same order that it will Serializer.read(ReadContext).

  • Constructor Details

    • WriteContext

      public WriteContext(ByteBuffer buffer, WritableByteChannel channel)
      Constructs a new write context using buffer to write to channel.

    • WriteContext

      public WriteContext(ByteBuffer buffer)
      Constructs a new write context writing to buffer. Does not gracefully handle exhausted buffers.

    • WriteContext

      public WriteContext(ByteBuffer buffer, Consumer<? super ByteBuffer> flush)
      Constructs a new write context writing to buffer. The flush callback is invoked with the provided buffer once it is exhausted but a write operation requires more space, and is expected to flush the buffer to make space for new data.

    • putObject

      public <T> void putObject(T value)
      Writes value using the best matching serializer to the current position in the backing buffer and increments the position. If this has previously been invoked with value, writes a reference ID, instead.
